**Orange County Choppers** (**OCC**) is a motorcycle manufacturer and
[lifestyle brand](/wiki/Lifestyle_brand "Lifestyle brand") company based in
the [town of Newburgh](/wiki/Newburgh_\(town\),_New_York "Newburgh \(town\),
New York"), located in [Orange County](/wiki/Orange_County,_New_York "Orange
County, New York"), [New York](/wiki/New_York_\(state\) "New York \(state\)"),
that was founded in 1999 by [Paul Teutul Sr.](/wiki/Paul_Teutul_Sr. "Paul
Teutul Sr."), The company was featured on _[American
Chopper](/wiki/American_Chopper "American Chopper")_ , a [reality TV
show](/wiki/Reality_television "Reality television") that debuted in September
2002 on the [Discovery Channel](/wiki/Discovery_Channel "Discovery Channel").
The series moved to Discovery Channel's sister channel
[TLC](/wiki/TLC_\(TV_channel\) "TLC \(TV channel\)") in 2007. Following
cancellation of the Discovery series, the company was also featured on _Orange
County Choppers_ on the [CMT](/wiki/CMT_\(U.S._TV_channel\) "CMT \(U.S. TV
channel\)") network in 2013. ‘’Orange County Choppers ‘’returned to [Discovery
Channel ](/wiki/Discovery_Channel "Discovery Channel") on March 1 2018 for a
premier viewing of their reboot of American Chopper. The full series is set to
start on May 28 2018.

##
History[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Orange_County_Choppers&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: History")]

[![\[icon\]](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1c/Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg/20px-
Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg.png)](/wiki/File:Wiki_letter_w_cropped.svg)| This
section **needs expansion**. You can help by [adding to
it](//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Orange_County_Choppers&action=edit&section=).
_(December 2011)_  
---|---  
  
In the late 1990s, Paul Teutul Sr. began manufacturing custom motorcycles as
an extension of his steel business (OC Iron Works), and in 1999 he founded
Orange County Choppers. The company's first bike, "True Blue," was debuted at
the 1999 Daytona [Biketoberfest](/wiki/Biketoberfest "Biketoberfest").

##
Bikes[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Orange_County_Choppers&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Bikes")]

Main article: [Orange County Choppers
bikes](/wiki/Orange_County_Choppers_bikes "Orange County Choppers bikes")

OCC is known for building custom theme bikes featured on _[American
Chopper](/wiki/American_Chopper "American Chopper")_. Additionally, OCC
launched a limited edition production line of motorcycles in July 2007, priced
beginning at $31,000.

One of OCC's most popular bikes is The Fire Bike, to commemorate the New York
firefighters who lost their lives on 9/11. The bike itself has been modeled
after a fire truck, and an actual steel rivet from the World Trade Center has
been integrated into the bike itself, mounted atop the bike's gas tank. Paul
Jr. stated that the bike was named "343", the number of New York firefighters
who gave their lives on 9/11.[1]

The popularity of _American Chopper_ led the United States Air Force to
commission a $150,000 "Air Force Bike", first put on public display in March
2005. The motorcycle is ten feet long and is modeled after the [F-22
Raptor](/wiki/F-22_Raptor "F-22 Raptor"), complete with Air Force symbol rims,
riveted gas tank, Raptor exhausts and rear view mirrors in the shape of jets.

##
Music[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Orange_County_Choppers&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: Music")]

Orange County Choppers held a series of free music performances within the
retail store. [P.O.D.](/wiki/P.O.D. "P.O.D."), [Candlebox](/wiki/Candlebox
"Candlebox"), [Saliva](/wiki/Saliva_\(band\) "Saliva \(band\)"),
[Red](/wiki/Red_\(band\) "Red \(band\)"), [10 Years](/wiki/10_Years_\(band\)
"10 Years \(band\)"), [Fair to Midland](/wiki/Fair_to_Midland "Fair to
Midland"), and [Framing Hanley](/wiki/Framing_Hanley "Framing Hanley") have
performed. On April 25, 2009, [Smile Empty Soul](/wiki/Smile_Empty_Soul "Smile
Empty Soul") and [Earshot](/wiki/Earshot "Earshot") performed to celebrate the
decade of the company's work. Additionally, OCC in October in conjunction with
RED/Sony released a classic rock compilation CD featuring some of Paul Sr.'s
favorite songs titled _OCC Rocks_. The CD also includes original music from
The OCC Band, which features four of the shop's employees. [Black Label
Society](/wiki/Black_Label_Society "Black Label Society") performed a concert
in the retail store to promote their album _[Order of the
Black](/wiki/Order_of_the_Black "Order of the Black")_.[2]

## Orange County Choppers
MotoCoaster[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Orange_County_Choppers&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Orange County Choppers MotoCoaster")]

The MotoCoaster is a [Zamperla](/wiki/Zamperla "Zamperla") built motorbike
themed roller coaster installed at [Darien Lake](/wiki/Darien_Lake "Darien
Lake") theme park in Darien Lake, NY. It was the first motorbike roller
coaster to be installed in the United States, though the [Pony
Express](/wiki/Pony_Express "Pony Express"), a similar model of coaster with
horse themed trains, was erected [Knott's Berry
Farm](/wiki/Knott%27s_Berry_Farm "Knott's Berry Farm"). The MotoCoaster is the
same model as the prototype located outside Zamperla's factory in Italy.

The MotoCoaster opened in May 2008 with Orange County Choppers securing the
[naming rights](/wiki/Naming_rights "Naming rights"). The MotoCoaster is
located near the Darien Square area of the park, between Boomerang and
Twister. Orange County Choppers built a custom motorcycle inspired by the ride
and the park. The coaster was originally named the Orange County Choppers
Motocoaster when it first opened in 2008. However, the name was changed to the
MotoCoaster in 2010 after the naming rights with OCC expired.

## Popular
meme[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Orange_County_Choppers&action=edit&section=7
"Edit section: Popular meme")]

A popular internet [meme](/wiki/Meme "Meme"), started in 2011 and based on the
show, became widely popular on social media in early 2018. The meme consists
of five panels depicting a dispute between Paul Sr. and his son Paul Jr. In
the original scene, Paul Sr. shouts at Paul Jr. for being late to work and
Paul Jr. shouts back, throws a chair, and then eventually storms away. In the
meme, users enter the dialogue of the five panels to create a dispute over any
issue.[3][4]
